Expenditures for garage services.
Expenditures for Jail Stores Commissary Services
Expenditures for jail stores commissary services.
Expenditures for Contingency Services
Expenditures for contingency services.
Expenditures for Convention Center Services
Expenditures for convention center services.
Expenditures for Conservation Services
Expenditures for conservation services.
Expenditures for Capital outlay

Expenditures for capital outlay which can include construction such as production, additions, replacements, or major structural alterations to buildings and other improvements. May also include purchase of equipment, land, and existing structures including capital leases.
Expenditures for Inter Governmental Activities

Expenditures for inter-governmental activities. Inter-governmental, a fourth character classification, is appropriate where one governmental unit transfers resources to another, such as when states transfer shared revenues to local governments or act as an intermediary in federally financed programs.
Other Expenditures
Other expenditures which the reporting entity does not separately disclose in the same statement or note.
Expenditures
Expenditures.
Excess (Deficiency) of Revenues Over (Under) Expenditures
Excess (deficiency) of revenues over (under) expenditures.
Other Financing Sources (Uses) [Abstract]
Information about other financing sources and uses.
Transfers Out for Financing Sources

Transfer which are outflows of assets to a financing source. A transfer is a flow of assets (such as cash or goods) without equivalent flows of assets in return and without a requirement for repayment. This category includes payments in lieu of taxes that are not payments for, and are not reasonably equivalent in value to, services provided. In governmental funds, transfers should be reported as other financing uses in the funds making transfers and as other financing sources in the funds receiving transfers. In proprietary funds, transfers should be reported after nonoperating revenues and expenses.”
Transfers In to Financing Sources

Transfers which are inflows of assets to a fund. A transfer is a flow of assets (such as cash or goods) without equivalent flows of assets in return and without a requirement for repayment. This category includes payments in lieu of taxes that are not payments for, and are not reasonably equivalent in value to, services provided. In governmental funds, transfers should be reported as other financing uses in the funds making transfers and as other financing sources in the funds receiving transfers. In proprietary funds, transfers should be reported after nonoperating revenues and expenses.
Other Financing Sources (Uses)

Other financing sources (uses) which the reporting entity does not separately disclose in the same statement or note. It includes a limited number of special transactions that are used to account for non-operating revenues or receipts and expenditures or disbursements . Included in this financial reporting category are operating transfers (inflow) and proceeds from debt transactions.
Fund Balance at Beginning of Period (Before Adjustment)
Adjustments in Fund Balances for Restatements (Errors and Accounting Policy)

Adjustments in fund balances for restatements (errors and accounting policy), includes prior period adjustments to fund balances. Items that are reported as prior-period adjustments should, in single-period statements, be reflected as adjustments of the opening balance of net position. When comparative statements are presented, corresponding adjustments should be made of the amounts reported in the flows statement and the statement of net position for all of the periods reported therein to reflect the retroactive application of the prior-period adjustments. (See paragraph .125 for required disclosures of prior-period Adjustments.) [GASBS 62 and 61, as amended by GASBS 63 and 8].
Adjustments in Fund Balances for Decrease (Increase) in Assets
Adjustments in fund balances to account for decrease (increase) in assets.
Adjustments in Fund Balances for Increase (Decrease) in Liabilities
Adjustments in fund balances to account for increase (decrease) in liabilities.
Net Change in Fund Balance
Amount of net change in fund balance.
Fund Balance at End of Period
Name of Other Revenues, Gov Income [Table]
Used to collect information about other revenues.
Name of Other Revenues [Axis]
Used as an identifier for the name of other revenues.
Name of Other Expenditures, Gov Income [Table]
Used to collect information about other expenditures.
Name of Other Expenditures [Axis]
Used as an identifier for the name of other expenditures.
Name of Other Financing Sources (Uses), Gov Income [Table]
Used to collect information about other financing sources and uses.
Name of Other Financing Sources (Uses) [Axis]
Used as an identifier for the name of other financing sources (uses).
Proprietary Funds, Statement of Net Position [Abstract]
Information about Proprietary Funds, Statement of Net Position.
Proprietary Funds Type of Activities [Abstract]
Information about Proprietary Funds, Statement of Net Position, Type of Activities.
Proprietary Funds, Statement of Net Position [Table]
Used to collect information about the Proprietary Funds, Statement of Net Position.
Proprietary Funds, Statement of Net Position [Line Items]
Used to group information about the Proprietary Funds Statement of Net Position.
Unrestricted Current Assets [Abstract]
Information about unrestricted current assets on the Proprietary Funds, Statement of Net Position.
Investments
Sum of investments and unrestricted cash as of the balance sheet date.
Due From Related Parties
Amounts due from related parties including affiliates, employees, joint ventures, officers and stockholders, immediate families thereof, and pension funds within one year.
Property Tax Receivable (Net of Allowances)
Property taxes receivable reported net of allowances. Property taxes are ad-valorem taxes levied on an assessed valuation of real property.
Tuition and Fees Receivable (Net of Allowances)

Monies owed for educational related services. These receivables are considered to be valid as due and payable and for which there is no apparent disagreement over the validity of the claim or the amount at the time it was established.
Tenant Accounts Receivable

Cumulative total balance of all tenant charges due, owed and outstanding, such as dwelling rent, maintenance charges, late fees, excess utility charges, and other charges owed to the PHA. This line includes the gross amount due from tenants excluding amounts owed due to participants that committed fraud or misrepresentation and now owe additional rent for periods or retroactive rent.
Allowance for Doubtful Accounts
Asset valuation allowances for losses, such as those on tenant receivables, should be deducted from the assets or groups of assets to which the allowances relate, with appropriate disclosure.
Government Claims Receivable
Amounts due from a state or other governmental entity withing one year which have not yet been received as of the balance sheet date.
Notes Receivable, Short Term

An amount representing an agreement for an unconditional promise by the maker to pay the Entity (holder) a definite sum of money at a future date(s) within one year of the balance sheet date. Such amount may include accrued interest receivable in accordance with the terms of the note. The note also may contain provisions including a discount or premium, payable on demand, secured, or unsecured, interest bearing or noninterest bearing, among myriad other features and characteristics.
Assessments Receivable
Special assessments due within one year but not yet collected as of the balance sheet date.
Other Accounts Receivable

Not elsewhere classified fees and other revenue recorded based on estimates or specific contractual terms as transactions occur or services are rendered, provided that persuasive evidence exists, the price to the customer is fixed or determinable and collectability is reasonably assured, which have not yet been received as of the balance sheet date.
Unrestricted Current Assets

Sum of the carrying amounts as of the balance sheet date of all assets that are expected to be realized in cash, sold, or consumed within one year. Assets are probable future economic benefits obtained or controlled by an entity as a result of past transactions or events.
Restricted Assets [Abstract]
Information about restricted assets.
Receivables and Other Restricted Assets
Total assets that cannot be used for operating purposes because of contract or regulatory requirements that are in effect for a period that extends beyond one year.
Cash and Cash Equivalents with Fiscal Agent
Cash and cash equivalents with fiscal agent.
Cash With Escrow Agent
Amount of cash with escrow agent.
Cash and Investments in Segregated Accounts
Cash and investments in segregated accounts.
Land
Amount before accumulated depletion of real estate held for productive use, excluding land held for sale.
On Site Improvements

Amount before accumulated depreciation and depletion of additions or improvements to real estate held for productive use. Examples include, but are not limited to, walkways, driveways, fences, and parking lots.
Subsidies
Amount of subsidies.
Buildings

Amount before accumulated depreciation of building structures held for productive use including addition, improvement, or renovation to the structure, including, but not limited to, interior masonry, interior flooring, electrical, and plumbing.
Furniture and Equipment

Amount before accumulated depreciation of equipment commonly used in offices and stores that have no permanent connection to the structure of a building or utilities. Examples include, but are not limited to, desks, chairs, tables, and bookcases.
Construction in Progress
Amount of structure or a modification to a structure under construction. Includes recently completed structures or modifications to structures that have not been placed into service.
Capital Assets Being Depreciated
Amount before accumulated depreciation, depletion and amortization of physical assets used in the normal conduct of business and not intended for resale.
Capital Assets, Not Being Depreciated, Net
Net capital assets, classified as not being depreciated.
Capital Assets Being Depreciated, Net
Net capital assets being depreciated.
Accumulated Amortization
The accumulation of amortization.
Other Capital Assets
Other types of capital assets which are physical assets used in the normal conduct of business and not intended for sale.
Long Term Investments
Long term investments.
Other Noncurrent Assets [Abstract]
Information about other noncurrent assets.
Long Term Notes Receivable
An amount representing an agreement for an unconditional promise by the maker to pay the Entity (holder) a definite sum of money at a future date(s) beyongwithin one year of the balance sheet date.
Interest Receivable on Long Term notes

The interest portion of any amount representing an agreement for an unconditional promise by the maker to pay the Entity (holder) a definite sum of money at a future date(s) beyongwithin one year of the balance sheet date.
Deferred Charges

Expenditures made during the current reporting period for benefits that will be received over a period of years. Deferred charges differ from prepaid expenses in that they usually extend over a long period of time and may or may not be regularly recurring costs of operation.
State University Retirement Contributions
Contributions to pension or retirement plan for state university and community college (higher education) systems.
Deferred Amount on Refunding
Losses from the issuance of new debt whose proceeds are used to repay previously issued debt
Other Deferred Outflows of Resources
Other deferred inflow of resources which is an acquisition of net assets by the government that is applicable to a future reporting period.
Accounts Payable and Accrued Expenses

Carrying value as of the balance sheet date of liabilities incurred (and for which invoices have typically been received) and payable to vendors for goods and services received that are used in an entity's operations and due within one year.
Other Accrued Liabilities

Carrying value as of the balance sheet date of obligations incurred and payable, pertaining to costs that are statutory in nature, are incurred on contractual obligations, or accumulate over time and for which invoices have not yet been received or will not be rendered and not elsewehere classified.
Due to Related Parties
Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of obligations due all related parties.
Unearned Grant Revenues
Payment from the sponsor prior to the sponsored research/work being performed.
Unearned Tuition and Fee Revenues
Amounts paid for courses that are not completed by the balance sheet date.
Total Accrued Expenses and Unearned Revenues
Payments received for revenues not yet earned in the current fiscal year.
Self Insurance Liabilities, Current Portion

Current portion of accrued known and estimated losses incurred as of the balance sheet date for which no insurance coverage exists, and for which a claim has been made or is probable of being asserted, typically arising from workmen's compensation-type of incidents and personal injury to nonemployees from accidents on the entity's property.
Deposits Held in Custody for Others
Amounts invested on behalf of affiliated entities.
Accrued Health Care Liability
Accrued health care liability.
Current Liabilities Payable from Restricted Assets [Abstract]
Information about other current liabilities payable from restricted assets.
Tenant Security Deposits Payable from Restricted Assets

Amount of deposits (security and pet deposits) that are held for tenants and are to be returned on the termination of their leases after deducting rent due and charges for property damages for which tenants are held responsible.
Due to Other Agencies Payable from Restricted Assets
Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of obligations due to other public agencies and payable from restricted assets.
Unearned Revenue Payable from Restricted Assets
Payments received for revenues not yet earned in the current fiscal year and payable from restricted assets.
Other Current Liabilities Payable from Restricted Assets
Other current liabilities payable from restricted assets.
Current Liabilities Payable from Resticted Assets

Obligations payable from restricted assets whose liquidation is reasonably expected to require the use of existing resources properly classifiable as current assets, or the creation of other current liabilities.
Self-insurance Liabilities, Net of Current Portion

Non-current portion of accrued known and estimated losses incurred as of the balance sheet date for which no insurance coverage exists, and for which a claim has been made or is probable of being asserted, typically arising from workmen's compensation-type of incidents and personal injury to nonemployees from accidents on the entity's property.
Payable from Restricted Assets [Abstract]
Amounts owed for goods and services received by a government, payable from restricted assets.
Family Self Sufficiency Escrows

Family Self-Sufficiency (FSS) is an employment-focused program available to individuals and families receiving Housing Choice Voucher or Public Housing assistance through Housing Connect. The FSS program directs an amount based on the rent increase to an interest-bearing escrow account maintained by a Public Housing Authority that is disbursed to participants when they reach key employment and self-sufficiency milestones.
Other Noncurrent Liabilities, Payable from Restricted Assets
Obligations scheduled to mature beyond one year from the date of a government’s financial statements not elsewhere classified and payable from restricted assets.
Due to Related Parties, Payable from Restricted Assets
Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of obligations due all related parties payable from restricted assets.
Noncurrent Liabilities Payable from Restricted Assets
Obligations scheduled to mature beyond one year from the date of a government’s financial statements and payable from restricted assets.
Deferred Amount on Refunding
Gains from the issuance of new debt whose proceeds are used to repay previously issued debt
Deferred Property Tax Revenues
When property taxes receivable are recognized, or when property taxes are collected in advance of the period for which they are levied, they should be recorded as a deferred inflow of resources
Other Deferred Inflows of Resources
Other deferred inflows of resources.
Restricted Net Position for Debt Service
Restricted assets legally allocated to debt service reduced by liabilities and deferred inflows of resources related to those assets.
Restricted Net Position for Unspent Grant Proceeds
Net assets that must be allocated to fulfilling terms of a specific grant.
Restricted Net Position for Working Cash
An internal loan fund that an entity establishes to ensure that it has adequate liquidity during times of negative cashflow.
Restricted Net Position for Capital Projects
Restricted net position for capital projects.
Other Restricted Components of Net Position
Other restricted components of net position which consists of restricted assets reduced by liabilities and deferred inflows of resources related to those assets.
Name of Other Unrestricted Current Assets [Axis]
Used as an identifier for other types of unrestricted current assets.
Other Unrestricted Current Assets
Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of other unrestricted assets that are expected to be realized in cash, sold, or consumed within one year.
Name of Other Restricted Current Assets [Axis]
Used as an identifier for other types of restricted current assets.
Other Restricted Current Assets
Other types of restricted assets. Assets should be reported as restricted when restrictions on asset use change the nature or normal understanding of the availability of the asset.
Name of Other Capital Assets [Axis]
Used as an identifier for other capital assets.
Name of Other Deferred Outflows of Resources [Axis]
Used as an identifier for other deferred outflows of resources.
Name of Other Current Liabilities Payable from Restricted Assets [Axis]
Used as an identifier for other current liabilities payable from restricted assets.
Name of Other Noncurrent Liabilities Payable from Restricted Assets [Axis]
Used as an identifier for other noncurrent liabilities payable from restricted assets.
Name of Other Deferred Inflows of Resources [Axis]
Used as an identifier for other deferred Inflows of resources.
Name of Other Restricted Components of Net Position [Axis]
Used as an identifier for other restricted components of net position.
Name of Proprietary Funds Business Type Activity Fund [Axis]
Represents types of funds for business type activities.
Proprietary Funds, Revenues, Expenses and Changes in Fund Net Position [Abstract]
Information about the Proprietary Funds Statement of Revenues, Expenses and Changes in Fund Net Position.
Proprietary Funds, Statement of Revenues, Expenses and Changes in Fund Net Position [Table]
Used to collect information about the Proprietary Funds, Statement of Revenues, Expenses and Changes in Fund Net Position.
Proprietary Funds, Statement of Revenues, Expenses and Changes in Fund Net Position [Line Items]
Used to group information about the Proprietary Funds Statement of Revenues, Expenses and Changes in Fund Net Position.
Operating Revenues [Abstract]
Information about operating revenues.
Revenue From Tuition and Fees
All tuition and fees assessed against students for educational and general purposes.
Revenue From Tuition and Fees (Net of Allowances)
All tuition and fees (less refunds, remissions, and exemptions) assessed against students for educational and general purposes.
Scholarship Allowances

That part of a scholarship or fellowship that is used to pay institutional charges such as tuition and fees or room and board charges. Scholarships and fellowships include Outright grants-in-aid, trainee stipends, tuition and fee waivers, and prizes awarded to students by the institution, including Pell grants. Awards to undergraduate students are most commonly referred to as "scholarships" and those to graduate students as "fellowships." These awards do not require the performance of services while a student (such as teaching) or subsequently as a result of the scholarship or fellowship. The term does not include loans to students (subject to repayment), College Work-Study Program (CWS), or awards granted to a parent of a student because of the parent's faculty or staff status. Also not included are awards to students where the selection of the student recipient is not made by the institution.
Revenue From Rent

Revenue from dwelling rents including credit amount for which the participant is entitled to a utility allowance payment. If the rent calculation, after deducting the utility allowance, results in a utility reimbursement due to the tenant, the amounts of such utility reimbursement is included as a debit to this account.
Fare Revenue

All income received directly from passengers, paid either in cash or through pre-paid tickets, passes, etc. It includes donations from those passengers who donate money on the vehicle. It includes the reduced fares paid by passengers in a user-side subsidy arrangement.
Sales and Service Fees

Sales and services fees, for example, commissions from bookstore sales, community memberships to college fitness center, ticket sales and concession sales for events at a performing arts center, fees collected for services provided by hands-on technical lab courses, for example auto labs.
Regulated Operating Revenue, Waste Water
The amount of waste water operating revenues recognized during the period.
Regulated Operating Revenue, Water
The amount of regulated water operating revenues recognized during the period.
Parking and Rental Services Revenue
Revenue from rental services and fees, whether long-term or daily, charged for parking facilities.
Revenue From Auxiliary Enterprises
Revenue from auxiliary enterprises.
Revenue From Charges for Utilities
Revenue from charges for utilities.
Revenue From Sale of Fuel
Revenue from sale of fuel.
Other Operating Revenue
Operating revenue, not elsewhere classified.
Operating Revenue

Governments should establish a policy that defines operating revenues and expenses that is appropriate to the nature of the activity being reported, disclose it in the summary of significant accounting policies, and use it consistently from period to period. A consideration for defining a proprietary fund's operating revenues and expenses is how individual transactions would be categorized for purposes of preparing a statement of cash flows using Section 2450.
Operating Expenses [Abstract]
Information about operating expenses.
Expenditures for Instruction

Instruction consists of those activities dealing directly with the teaching of students. It includes the activities of faculty in the baccalaureate-oriented/transfer, occupational-technical career, general studies, and remedial and ABE/ASE programs (associate degree credit and certificate credit). It includes expenditures for department chairpersons, administrators, and support staff for whom instruction is an important role. It also includes all equipment, materials, supplies, and costs that are necessary to support the instructional program. Instructional salaries ordinarily will be allocated among the subprograms (instructional area) according to teaching assignment. If this is not possible (or immaterial), instructional salaries should be reported under the subprogram (instructional area) that best reflects the employee's primary area of assignment.
Expenditures for Academic Support

Expenses that include activities designed to provide support services for the institution's primary missions of instruction, public service, and research. Academic support includes the operation ofthe library, educational media services, instructional materials center, and academiccomputing used in the learning process. Some other activities include tutoring, learning skills centers, and reading and writing centers, that can be reported in the “2090 Other” category. It also includes expenditures for all equipment, materials, supplies, and costs that are necessary to support this function.
Expenditures for Student Grants and Scholarships
Expenditures for student aid in the form of scholarships or prizes.
Expenditures for Student Services

The student services function provides assistance in the areas of financial aid, admissions and records, health, placement, testing, counseling, and student activities. It includes all equipment, materials, supplies, and costs that are necessary to support this function.
Expenditures for Suppliers
Expenditures for suppliers.
Expenditures for Supplies, Services and Claims
The amount of expense recognized for supplies, services and claims.
Expenditures for Auxiliary Enterprises

Auxiliary Services provides for the operation of the cafeteria, bookstore, student organizations, athletics, and other related activities. It also includes all equipment, materials, supplies, and costs that are necessary to support this function. Activities included in Auxiliary Services should be self-supporting. Fund raising activities should be reported in the Institutional Support program/subprogram Community Relations 8030.
Expenditures for Operation and Maintenance of Plant

Operation of plant consists of housekeeping activities necessary in order to keep the physical facilities open and ready for use. Maintenance of plant consists of those activities necessary to keep the grounds, buildings, and equipment operating efficiently. This function also provides for campus security and plant utilities, as well as equipment, materials, supplies, fire protection, property insurance, and other costs that are necessary to support this function.
Expenditures for General and Administrative

The aggregate total of expenses of managing and administering the affairs of an entity, including affiliates of the reporting entity, which are not directly or indirectly associated with the manufacture, sale or creation of a product or product line.
Expenditures for Institutional Support
General Institution Includes legal services, general insurance, remodeling, internet provider costs, and other items b the institution. building enefitting
Depreciation Expense

The amount of expense recognized in the current period that reflects the allocation of the cost of tangible assets over the assets' useful lives. Includes production and non-production related depreciation.
Amortization Expense
The amount of amortization expense recognized in the current period.
Bad Debt Expense
Expenses for bad debt.
Expenditures for Personal Services and Benefits
Personal services and benefits which include salaries and non-wage compensation for State employees and certain payments to non-State employees.
Expenditures for Other Operating Activities
The amount of expense for operating activities, not elsewhere classified.
Expenditures for Utilities
Utility costs incurred including those for water, sewer, electrictity and gas.
Expediture for Housing Assistance Payments

Housing assistance payments (HAP) for the Housing Choice Voucher (HCV) or similar type program paid or accrued to the owners of dwelling units leased to eligible families. Also included are HAP related expenses such as contributions to FSS escrow accounts, utility reimbursements, and mortgage payments paid using HAP subsidy for a HCV homeownership program. In addition this account includes, where applicable, HAP payments paid or accrued to owners for vacancies during and after rent-up pursuant to a housing assistance payments contract, and HAP payments paid or accrued to owners for reimbursement pursuant to the provisions of the housing assistance contract for any unpaid rent or damages caused by the tenants.
Expenditures for Tenant Services
Costs incurred for services directly related to meeting resident needs and supporting a wholesome living environment including employee salaries and benefits.
Expenditures for Insurance
Costs for property, liabilty and other types of insurance including workers' compensation.
Expenditures for Maintenance and Operations

Costs for providing routine and preventive maintenance as well as operating services, such as janitorial services, elevator service, extermination of rodents and household pests, and rubbish and garbage elevator service, extermination of rodents and household pests, and rubbish and garbage collection.
Expenditures for Protective Services
Costs of labor, contracts, expendible materials and supplies related to protecting tenants, projects, programs and other assets.
Expenditures for Contractual Services
Expenditures for contractual services.
Expenditures for Materials and Supplies
Expenditures for materials and supplies.
Expenditures for Financial Aid
Expenditure for financial aid.
Other Operating Expenses
Operating Expenses, not elsewhere classified.
Operating Expense
Operating expenses are those expenses directly attributable to the operations of the College. Incidental expenses are classified as non-operating expenses.
Operating Income (Loss)
The net result for the period of deducting operating expenses from operating revenues.
Nonoperating Revenues Expenses [Abstract]
Information about nonoperating revenues and expenses.
Revenue From Subsidies
Revenue from a subsidy which is a direct or indirect payment, usually in the form of a cash payment from the government or a targeted tax cut.
Grants, Contributions and Donations from Local Governmental Entities
Grants, contributions and donations from local governmental entities.
Expenditures for Interest Payments
Expenditures for interest payments.
Expenditures for Issuance and Amortization of Bond Discount.
Expenditures for bond issuance and amortization of bond discount.
State OPEB Contribution
State OPEB on-behalf contribution.
Personal Property Replacement Tax

Revenues collected by the State, and paid to local governments, to replace money that was lost by local governments when their powers to impose personal property taxes on corporations, partnerships, and other business entities were abolished in the 1970 Constitution.
Gifts
Gifts.
State Appropriations
State appropriations.
State Retirement Plan Contributions
State retirement plan contributions.
Other Nonoperating Revenues Expenses
Other nonoperating revenues or expenses.
Nonoperating Gains (Losses)
The aggregate amount of gains or losses resulting from nonoperating activities (for example, interest and dividend revenue, property, plant and equipment impairment loss, and so forth).
Income (Loss) before Capital Contributions
Income (loss) before capital contributions.
Transfers and Contributions [Abstract]
Information about transfers and contributions.
Transfers of Capital Assets From (To) Other Funds
Amount of transfer payments which is a one-way payment to a person who has given or exchanged no money, good, or service for it, for example, Social Security, Medicaid, and unemployment insurance.
Contributions, Capital
Amount of capital contributions.
Contributions from Citizens and Developers
Amount of contributions to government from citizens and developers.
Contributions, Other

Amount of contributions classified as other. Contributions to term and permanent endowments, contributions to permanent fund principal, special and extraordinary items (defined in paragraphs .145 and .146), and transfers (defined in paragraph .102) between governmental and business-type activities should each be reported separately from, but in the same manner as, general revenues.
Net Transfers

Net transfers. A transfer is a flow of assets (such as cash or goods) without equivalent flows of assets in return and without a requirement for repayment. This category includes payments in lieu of taxes that are not payments for, and are not reasonably equivalent in value to, services provided. In governmental funds, transfers should be reported as other financing uses in the funds making transfers and as other financing sources in the funds receiving transfers. In proprietary funds, transfers should be reported after nonoperating revenues and expenses.
Transfers and Contributions

Transfers and contributions. A transfer is a flow of assets (such as cash or goods) without equivalent flows of assets in return and without a requirement for repayment. This category includes payments in lieu of taxes that are not payments for, and are not reasonably equivalent in value to, services provided. In governmental funds, transfers should be reported as other financing uses in the funds making transfers and as other financing sources in the funds receiving transfers. In proprietary funds, transfers should be reported after nonoperating revenues and expenses. Contributions to term and permanent endowments, contributions to permanent fund principal, special and extraordinary items (defined in paragraphs .145 and .146), and transfers (defined in paragraph .102) between governmental and business-type activities should each be reported separately from, but in the same manner as, general revenues.
Changes in Net Position, Business Type Activities
Changes in net position for business type activities.
Changes in Net Position, Business Type Activities, Enterprise Funds, Adjusted
Adjusted changes in net position for business type activities for enterprise funds.
Changes in Net Position, Business Type Activities, Enterprise Funds
Changes in net position for business type activities for enterprise funds.
Change in Accounting Principle
Value of a change in an accounting principle which is a change in a method used, such as using a different depreciation method or switching between LIFO to FIFO inventory valuation methods.
Net Position, Restated
Net position, restated.
Name of Other Operating Revenue [Axis]
Used as an identifier for other operating revenues.
Name of Other Operating Expenses [Axis]
Used as an identifier for other operating Expensess.
Name of Other Nonoperating Revenues Expenses [Axis]
Used as an identifier for other nonoperating revenues and expenses.
Name of Proprietary Funds Business Type Activity Fund [Axis]
Represents types of funds for business type activities.
Proprietary Funds, Statement of Cash Flows [Abstract]
Information about the Proprietary Funds Statement of Cash Flows.
Proprietary Funds, Statement of Cash Flows [Table]
Used to collect information about the Proprietary Funds Statement of Cash Flows.
Proprietary Funds, Statement of Cash Flows [Line Items]
Used to group information about the Proprietary Funds Statement of Cash Flows.
Cash Flows from Operating Activities [Abstract]
Information about cash flows from operating activities.
Cash Flow from Tuition and Fees
Cash received from all tuition and fees (less refunds, remissions, and exemptions) assessed against students for educational and general purposes.
Cash Flow from Sales and Services
Cash inflows from sales of goods or services, including receipts from collection of accounts receivable and both short- and long-term notes receivable from customers arising from those sales.
Cash Payments to Employees
Cash payments to employees for services.
Cash Payments to Suppliers
Cash payments to other suppliers for other goods or services.
Cash Received from Tenants
Cash inflows from tenants for rents, fees and deposits.
Cash Received from Operating Grants
Cash receipts from grants for specific activities that are considered to be operating activities of the grantor government.
Cash Received from Customers
Cash inflows from sales of goods or services, including receipts from collection of accounts receivable and both short- and long-term notes receivable from customers arising from those sales.
Cash Housing Assistance Payments

Cash outflows from housing assistance payments (HAP) for the Housing Choice Voucher (HCV) or similar type program paid or accrued to the owners of dwelling units leased to eligible families. Also included in this line is HAP related expenses such as contributions to FSS escrow accounts, utility reimbursements, and mortgage payments paid using HAP subsidy for a HCV homeownership program. In addition this account includes, where applicable, HAP payments paid or accrued to owners for vacancies during and after rent-up pursuant to a housing assistance payments contract, and HAP payments paid or accrued to owners for reimbursement pursuant to the provisions of the housing assistance contract for any unpaid rent or damages caused by the tenants.
Cash Payments to Landlords
Cash payments to landlords.
Cash Received from Tap Fees
Cash received from tap fees which are connection fees used to cover the cost of service installation which may include a tap, service line, water meter, excavation or boring costs, paving costs, etc.
Other Cash Flows from Operating Activities
Other cash flows from operating activities, not elsewhere classified.
Net Cash Provided By (Used in) Operating Activities

Cash flows from from providing services and producing and delivering goods, and include all transactions and other events that are not defined as capital and related financing, noncapital financing, or investing activities. Cash flows from operating activities generally are the cash effects of transactions and other events that enter into the determination of operating income.
Cash from Operations
Cash flows from operating activities.
Cash Flows from Non Capital Financing Activities [Abstract]
Information about cash flows from non capital financing activities.
Cash from Real Estate Taxes and Corporate Personal Property Replacement Taxes

Education district taxes include all tax revenues assessed directly by an institution or on behalf of an institution when the institution will receive the exact amount collected. These revenues also include similar revenues that result from actions of local governments or citizens (such as through a referendum) that result in receipt by the institution of revenues based on collections of other taxes or resources (sales taxes, gambling taxes, etc.). Revenues from local government agencies that are for training programs and similar activities for which amounts are received or expenditures are reimbursable under the terms of a local government grant.
Cash from State Appropriations

State and local monies awarded to the institution under state and local student aid programs, including the state portion of State Student Incentives Grants (SSIG). (Used for reporting Student Financial Aid data).
Cash from Grants and Contracts

Cash received from governmental agencies and nongovernmental parties that are for specific research projects, other types of programs , or for general institutional operations (if not government appropriations). Examples are research projects, training programs, student financial assistance, and similar activities for which amounts are received or expenses are reimbursable under the terms of a grant or contract, including amounts to cover both direct and indirect expenses. Includes Pell Grants and reimbursement for costs of administering federal financial aid programs.
Cash from Interfund Activity
Cash from Interfund Activity.
Other Cash Flows from Non Capital Financing Activities
Other cash flows from non capital financing activities, not elsewhere classified.
Net Cash from Non Capital Financing Activities

Cash flows from borrowing money for purposes other than to acquire, construct, or improve capital assets and repaying those amounts borrowed, including interest. This category includes proceeds from all borrowings (such as revenue anticipation notes) not clearly attributable to acquisition, construction, or improvement of capital assets, regardless of the form of the borrowing. Also included are certain other interfund and intergovernmental receipts and payments
Cash Flows from Capital and Related Financing Activities [Abstract]
Information about cash flows from capital and related financing activities.
Cash Used in Purchases of Capital Assets
The cash outflow for purchases of and capital improvements on property, plant and equipment (capital expenditures).
Cash Provided by Sales of Bonds
The cash inflow from amounts received from a long-term debt security issued by a state, certain agencies or authorities, a local government, or development corporation.
Cash Provided by Premiums on Bonds
The cash inflow from amounts in excess of par received from a long-term debt security issued by a state, certain agencies or authorities, a local government, or development corporation.
Cash Used in Bond Principal Payments
The cash outflow to pay off borrowing used to receive debt funding.
Cash Used in Interest Paid on Bonds

Amount of cash paid for interest, excluding capitalized interest. Includes, but is not limited to, payment to settle zero-coupon bond for accreted interest of debt discount and debt instrument with insignificant coupon interest rate in relation to effective interest rate of borrowing attributable to accreted interest of debt discount.
Cash Provided by Proceeds from Sales of Capital Assets

Aggregate cash proceeds received from a combination of transactions that are classified as investing activities in which assets, which may include one or more investments, are sold to third-party buyers.
Cash Received from Capital Contributions
Cash received from Capital Contributions.
Other Cash Flows from Capital and Financing Related Activities
Other cash flows from capital and financing related activities.
Net Cash from Capital and Related Financing Activities

Cash flows from (a) acquiring and disposing of capital assets used in providing services or producing goods, (b) borrowing money for acquiring, constructing, or improving capital assets and repaying the amounts borrowed, including interest, and (c) paying for capital assets obtained from vendors on credit.
Cash Flows from Investing Activities [Abstract]
Information about cash flows from investing activities.
Cash Provided by Proceeds from Sales and Maturities of Investments
The cash inflow from maturities and liquidations of all investments, including securities and other assets
Cash Provided by Interest on Investments
The net cash inflow or outflow in Interest-bearing deposits and securities.
Cashed Used in Purchase of Investments

Amount of cash outflow from investing activities, including discontinued operations. Investing activity cash flows include making loans and acquiring of debt or equity instruments and property, plant, and equipment and other productive assets.
Other Cash Flows from Investing Activities
Other cash flows from investing activities.
Net Cash from Investing Activities
Cash flows from making and collecting loans (except program loans, as discussed in paragraph .116Open this link as a new document) and acquiring and disposing of debt or equity instruments.
Net Increase (Decrease) in Cash

Amount of increase (decrease) in cash and cash equivalents. Cash and cash equivalents are the amount of currency on hand as well as demand deposits with banks or financial institutions. Includes other kinds of accounts that have the general characteristics of demand deposits. Also includes short-term, highly liquid investments that are both readily convertible to known amounts of cash and so near their maturity that they present insignificant risk of changes in value because of changes in interest rates. Includes effect from exchange rate changes.
Cash and Cash Equivalents, Restricted Cash and Restricted Cash Equivalents

Amount of currency on hand as well as demand deposits with banks or financial institutions. Includes other kinds of accounts that have the general characteristics of demand deposits. Also includes short-term, highly liquid investments that are both readily convertible to known amounts of cash and so near their maturity that they present insignificant risk of changes in value because of changes in interest rates. Excludes cash and cash equivalents within disposal group and discontinued operation.
Name of Other Cash Flows from Operating Activities [Axis]
Used as an identifier for the name of other cash flows from operating activities.
Name of Other Cash Flows from Non Capital Financing Activities [Axis]
Used as an identifier for the name of other cash flows from non capital financing activities.
Name of Other Cash Flows from Capital and Related Financing Activities [Axis]
Used as an identifier for the name of other cash flows from capital and financing related activities.
Name of Other Cash Flows from Investing Activities [Axis]
Used as an identifier for the name of other cash flows from investing activities.
Pension Plans [Abstract]
Information about pension plans.
Pension Plans [Table]
Table used to capture information about the Employee Retirement And Pension Plans.
Pension Plan Name [Axis]
Used for identifiers for Pension Plans.
Pension Plans [Line Items]
Used to collect information about Pension Plans.
Pension Plan Name
Name of the pension plan.
Pension Plan Status
Indicates the status of the pension plan which can be open or closed.
Pension Plan Type
Indicates the pension plan type which can be single or agency multi-employer or cost-sharing multi-employer.
Pension Plan Category
Indicates if the plan is Defined Benefit or Defined Contribution.
Type of Employees Participating in Pension Plan
Type of employees participating in the pension plan, which can be Fire, Police, Public Safety, Teachers, Elected Officials, Judges, Mixed or Other.
Pension Plan Active Employees
The number of individuals employed at the end of the reporting or measurement period, as applicable.
Pension Plan Retirees And Beneficiaries Currently Receiving Normal And Disability Benefits
The number of pension plan retirees and beneficiaries currently receiving normal and disability benefits.
Pension Plan Terminated Employees Entitled To, But Not Yet Receiving, Benefits
The number of pension plan terminated employees entitled to benefits but not yet receiving benefits.
Pension Plan DROP Participants Receiving Benefits In DROP Accounts
The number of pension plan DROP (Deferred Retirement Option Plan) participants receiving benefits into their DROP accounts.
Pension Plan Disabled Participants Currently Receiving Benefits
The number of pension plan disabled participants currently receiving benefits.
Pension Plan Total Plan Membership
The number of individuals comprising the pension plan total membership.
Actuarially Determined Pension Contribution

A target or recommended contribution to a defined benefit pension plan for the reporting period, determined in conformity with Actuarial Standards of Practice based on the most recent measurement available when the contribution for the reporting period was adopted.
Actual Pension Contribution Made By the State and Other Entities
Contributions to a pension plan’s fiduciary net position for amounts from nonemployer contributing entities, such as a state government contributing to local government pension plans.
Actual Pension Contribution Made By Employees
Contributions to a pension plan’s fiduciary net position for amounts from employees.
Actual Pension Contribution Made By the Employer
Contributions to a pension plan’s fiduciary net position for amounts from the employer.
Net Investment Income Earned by the Pension Plan
Net investment income earned by the pension plan.
Benefit Payments Made By the Pension Plan
Benefit Payments Made By the Pension Plan
Pension Plan Interest Cost
Changes in Net Pension Liability due to interest on the total pension liability.
Pension Plan Service Cost
Changes in Net Pension Liability due to Service Costs.
Pension Plan Administrative Expenses
Changes in Net Pension Liability due to pension plan administrative expenses.
Annual Pension Expense
Employer’s required contributions to the pension plan for the reporting period and separate liabilities to the pension plan that arise in the reporting period
Pension Actuarial Valuation Date
Pension Actuarial Valuation Date
Pension Plan Contribution Rates As Percentage Of Payoll
Pension Plan Contribution Rates As A Percentage Of Payoll
Pension Plan Amortization Method
Pension Plan Amortization Method
Pension Plan Mortality Rate Table
Pension Plan Mortality Rate Table
Year Pension Plan Mortality Rate Table Last Published or Updated
Year in which Pension Plan Mortality Rate Table Was Last Published/Updated
Pension Plan Remaining Amortization Period
Pension Plan Remaining Amortization Period. Partial years are represented as decimal, e.g., 1 year and 6 months should be reported as 1.5.
Pension Plan Asset Valuation Method
Pension Plan Asset Valuation Method
Pension Assumed Inflation Rate
Pension Assumed Inflation Rate
Pension Assumed Salary Growth
Pension Assumed Salary Growth
Pension Discount Rate
The single rate of return that, when applied to all projected benefit payments, results in an actuarial present value of projected benefit payments.
Assumed Rate of Return on Pension Assets
Assumed Rate of Return on Pension Assets
Actual Rate of Return on Pension Assets
Actual Rate of Return on Penson Assets
Pension Plan Liability Measurement Date
Mesaurement Date for Pension Actuarial Analysis
Fiduciary Net Position
The net liability (or asset) of employers and nonemployer contributing entities to employees for benefits provided through a defined benefit pension plan.
Pension Funded Ratio
Pension Funded Ratio.
Pension Plan Covered Payroll
The payroll of employees that are provided with pensions through the pension plan.
Net Pension Liability At Assumed Discount Rate Minus 1%

Total pension liability (or, if an employer has a special funding situation, the employer’s proportionate share of the total pension liability) calculated using a discount rate that is 1-percentage-point lower than the assumed discount rate.
Net Pension Liability At Assumed Discount Rate Plus 1%

Total pension liability (or, if an employer has a special funding situation, the employer’s proportionate share of the total pension liability) calculated using a discount rate that is 1-percentage-point higher than the assumed discount rate.
Pension Plan Deferred Inflow Of Resources
Pension Plan Deferred Inflow Of Resources
Pension Plan Deferred Ouflow Of Resources
Pension Plan Deferred Ouflow Of Resources
Pension Plan Gain Loss Assumption Changes
Changes in Net Pension Liability due to changes of assumptions about future economic or demographic factors or of other inputs
Pension Plan Other Changes to Liability
Other Changes in Net Pension Liability.
Pension Plan Employer Contributions
Changes in Net Pension Liability due to contributions from the employer
Pension Plan Member Contributions
Changes in Net Pension Liability due to Contributions from Members
Noncurrent Assets
noncurrent assets.
Compensated Absences Payable, Noncurrent

Compensated absences payable, classified as noncurrent. Compensated absences are compensated time off such as vacation and sick leave, which has been earned by employees and probable that the employer will compensate the employees through paid time off or some other means, such as cash payments at termination or retirement but not yet compensated by the employer.
Other Noncurrent Liabilities Due in More Than One Year
Other noncurrent liabilities, due in more than one year, which are present obligations to sacrifice resources that the government has little or no discretion to avoid.
Other Noncurrent Liabilities Due Within One Year
Other noncurrent liabilities, due within one year, which are present obligations to sacrifice resources that the government has little or no discretion to avoid.
Long Term Liabilities, Noncurrent
Long-term liabilities, noncurrent.
Noncurrent Liabilities
noncurrent liabilities, which are present obligations to sacrifice resources that the government has little or no discretion to avoid.
General Revenues
General revenues which includes all revenues unless they are required to be reported as program revenues.
Restricted Cash and Investments
Amount of cash and investments restricted as to withdrawal or usage.
Total Pension Liabilities

The portion of the actuarial present value of projected benefit payments that is attributed to past periods of employee service in conformity with the requirements of this section. The total OPEB liability is the liability of employers and nonemployer contributing entities to employees for benefits provided through a defined benefit OPEB plan
OPEB [Abstract]
Information about OPEB.
OPEB Plans [Table]
Table used to capture information about the OPEB Plans.
OPEB Plan Name [Axis]
Used for identifiers for Pension Plans.
OPEB Plans [Line Items]
Used to collect information about OPEB Plans.
OPEB Plan Name
OPEB plan name.
OPEB Funded Ratio
OPEB Funded Ratio
Total OPEB Liabilities

The portion of the actuarial present value of projected benefit payments that is attributed to past periods of employee service in conformity with the requirements of this section. The total OPEB liability is the liability of employers and nonemployer contributing entities to employees for benefits provided through a defined benefit OPEB plan
Actuarially Determined OPEB Contribution

A target or recommended contribution to a defined benefit OPEB plan for the reporting period, determined in conformity with Actuarial Standards of Practice based on the most recent measurement available when the contribution for the reporting period was adopted.
OPEB Plan Assets
OPEB Plan Assets
OPEB Plan Status
Indicates if the OPEB plan is closed or open.
OPEB Plan Type
Indicates if the OPEB plan is single, multi-employer agency or multi-employer cost-sharing.
Type of Employees Participating in OPEB Plan
Indicates the type of employees participating in the OPEB plan, which could be Fire, Police, Public Safety, Teachers, Miscellaneous, Elected Officials or Other.
OPEB Plan Active Employees
Number of individuals employed at the end of the reporting or measurement period, as applicable.
OPEB Plan Terminated Employees Entitled To But Not Yet Receiving Benefits
Number of inactive employees who have accumulated benefits under the terms of an OPEB plan but are not yet receiving benefit payments.
OPEB Plan Retired Employees
Number of OPEB plan retired employees.
OPEB Expense

Employer’s required contributions to the OPEB plan for the reporting period, and separate liabilities to the OPEB plan that arise in the reporting period (for example, for amounts assessed to an individual employer upon joining a cost-sharing OPEB plan).
OPEB Actuarial Valuation Date
The date as of which an actuarial valuation is performed.
OPEB Plan Liability Measurement Date
OPEB plan liability measurement date.
Net OPEB Asset/Liability also known as Fiduciary Net Position
The net asset or liability of employers and nonemployer contributing entities to employees for benefits provided through a defined benefit OPEB plan.
OPEB Plan Covered Payroll
The payroll amount on which contributions to an OPEB plan are based.
OPEB Discount Rate
The single rate of return that, when applied to all projected benefit payments, results in an actuarial present value of projected benefit payments.
OPEB Assumed Rate of Return
OPEB assumed rate of return.
OPEB Assumed Inflation Rate
OPEB assumed inflation rate.
OPEB Assumed Healthcare Cost Trend Rate
The rates of change in per capita health claims costs over time as a result of factors such as medical inflation, utilization of healthcare services, plan design, and technological developments.
OPEB Assumed Salary Growth
OPEB assumed salary growth.
Net OPEB Liability At Assumed Discount Rate Minus 1%
Net OPEB liability (i.e., Fiduciary Net Position) calculated using a discount rate that is 1-percentage-point lower than the assumed discount rate.
Net OPEB Liability At Assumed Discount Rate Plus 1%
Net OPEB liability (i.e., Fiduciary Net Position) calculated using a discount rate that is 1-percentage-point higher than the assumed discount rate.
Net OPEB Liability at Assumed Healthcare Cost Trend Minus 1%
Net OPEB liability (i.e., Fiduciary Net Position) calculated using a healthcare cost trend rate that is 1-percentage-point lower than the assumed healthcare cost trend rate.
Net OPEB Liability at Assumed Healthcare Cost Trend Plus 1%
Net OPEB liability (i.e., Fiduciary Net Position) calculated using a healthcare cost trend rate that is 1-percentage-point higher than the assumed healthcare cost trend rate.
Actual OPEB Contribution Made By the State and Other Entities
Actual OPEB contribution made by the state and other entities.
Actual OPEB Contribution Made By Employees
Actual OPEB contribution made by employees.
Actual OPEB Contribution Made By the Employer
Actual OPEB contribution made by the employer.
Net Investment Income Earned by the OPEB Plan
Net Investment Income earned by the OPEB plan.
Benefit Payments Made By the OPEB Plan
Benefit payments made by the OPEB plan.
OPEB Plan Service Cost
The portions of the actuarial present value of projected benefit payments that are attributed to valuation years.
OPEB Plan Interest Cost
OPEB plan interest cost.
OPEB Plan Administrative Expenses
OPEB plan Administrative Expenses
OPEB Plan Gain/Loss Assumption Changes
OPEB plan gain/loss assumption changes.
OPEB Plan Gain/Loss Difference Between Actual and Expected Experience
OPEB plan gain/loss difference between actual and expected experience.
OPEB Plan Other Changes to Liability
OPEB plan other changes to liability.
OPEB Plan Employer Contributions
OPEB plan employer contributions.
OPEB Plan Member Contributions
OPEB plan member contributions.
